content:
Use Cases:

1. Admin wants to view the progress of the task:
a. Admin user logs into the system and navigates to the Specific Task screen.
b. Admin user selects the task they want to view.
c. The system displays the task information including the status, assigned tagger, checker, assigned date, due date, description, and a list of all documents assigned to this task.
d. The system displays a progress bar indicating the overall progress of the task.
e. Admin user can view the status of each document, including whether it has been tagged or checked.
f. Admin user can change the status of a document by clicking on the status field and selecting a new status from the dropdown menu.
2. Admin wants to assign a tagger to the task:
a. Admin user logs into the system and navigates to the Specific Task screen.
b. Admin user selects the task they want to assign a tagger to.
c. The system displays the task information.
d. Admin user clicks on the 'Assign Tagger' button.
e. The system displays a list of available taggers.
f. Admin user selects the tagger they want to assign to the task and clicks 'Assign'.
g. The system updates the task information to reflect the assigned tagger.
3. Admin wants to assign a checker to the task:
a. Admin user logs into the system and navigates to the Specific Task screen.
b. Admin user selects the task they want to assign a checker to.
c. The system displays the task information.
d. Admin user clicks on the 'Assign Checker' button.
e. The system displays a list of available checkers.
f. Admin user selects the checker they want to assign to the task and clicks 'Assign'.
g. The system updates the task information to reflect the assigned checker.
4. Tagger wants to start annotating a document:
a. Tagger user logs into the system and navigates to the Specific Task screen.
b. Tagger user selects the task they have been assigned to.
c. The system displays the task information and a list of all documents assigned to this task.
d. Tagger user clicks on the document they want to annotate.
e. The system opens the annotation tool and the tagger can start annotating the document.
f. Tagger user can save the annotated document and the system updates the status of the document to 'Ready for Review'.
5. Checker wants to review a document:
a. Checker user logs into the system and navigates to the Specific Task screen.
b. Checker user selects the task they have been assigned to.
c. The system displays the task information and a list of all documents assigned to this task.
d. Checker user clicks on the document they want to review.
e. The system opens the annotation tool and the checker can review the annotated document.
f. Checker user can approve the document or reject it with comments.
g. If the document is approved, the system updates the status of the document to 'Complete'. If the document is rejected, the system updates the status of the document to 'Rejected' and the tagger can start annotating the document again.
